title: Pixel 5 Not Detected By PC
content:
Hello,

I seem to be having an issue with my Pixel 5 where it is not detected by any of my PCs. I've tried connecting it to my PC as well as two laptops through a USC C to A cable (as none of my other devices have USB C plugs) and it's the same thing for all: The Pixel 5 is not detected. Windows doesn't even play the "device connected" sound and it doesn't show in Device Manager as a Portable Device or Unknown Device.

You'd think it's the cable but when plugging in my Essential PH-1 it works flawlessly and so does a Galaxy S10 on all three computers so this seems like not a Windows or cable issue but rather a Pixel issue. Also, the phone manages to charge while it is off using that same cable but immediately stops when turned back on which suggests a software issue. I also got the phone to connect ONCE, however, that was after it never being able to connect so I went into device manager and uninstalled all other phones as well as the Android ADB drivers.

It worked then but then I finished the day, turned off my PC, and today the problem is back on but this time without anything to uninstall to make it magically work (except for the Pixel 5 device itself which wasn't being detected as present. I tried updating the drivers and then uninstalling but it didn't work and now I truly have nothing).

I've tried turning USB Debugging on and off.
I've tried changing the Default USB Settings to each option.
I've tried plugging the cable into another port.

Anybody got any solutions?
